I have just spent seven days in the
eastern Great Lakes region called North
quipu and I really really enjoyed every
minute the Democratic Republic of Congo
is the 11th largest country in the world
and it's certainly one of the most
diverse while French is the official
language there are over 300 ethnic
groups each with their own traditions
and speaking their own mother tongue
it's far beyond my imagination
I've been travelling alongside my local
buddy Obed who reached out to me on
Instagram and turned into a great friend
of mine I was like very good you'll be
learning all about his inspiring story
in an upcoming video but in short he's
an entrepreneur activist and all-around
great guy we started our trip by
visiting the big city of Goma which was
much larger than I thought it's full of
life tasty food and these unique wooden
bicycles called cuckoos alpha to gamma
so in vila aki on gamma is a very
welcoming city to visitors all el Plaga
mo all the visitors they have space and
gamma then we headed into Virunga
National Park at an amazing Lodge in the
middle of the jungle
we spent the dead checking to see the
endangered mountain gorillas in their
natural habitat and it was unbelievable
right behind me you can see the mountain
gorillas which we trekked to ours then
we do have a few hours west into the
countryside called mossy see which has
the most beautiful grassy hills you can
imagine their birthday of the hall in
the Philippines but here it's way higher
mountains and they're just covered in
greenery it's not a jungle it's just
like grassy grassy hills I'm not losing
my breath because we're hiking to get
the best view point here but man this
country is beautiful after that we
headed back to town to attend a local
wedding which was a blast and the best
way for me to observe and experience
Congolese culture we proceeded to head
back into Verona to hike Africa's most
active volcano Mount Anita gongo
sitting at three thousand four hundred
and seventy meters high is the gate of
the AAF Tomac if you go deep inside you
go straight to the center of it we slept
overnight at the crater and admired the
world's largest lava lake so now as you
can see it is getting dark outside the
lava just illuminates the sky behind me
don't know enough to say besides the
fact that Earth is awesome finally we
ended a great week on a private island
in Lake ki vu
where we had time to relax and take in
the last week of our lives as I told you
earlier the DR Congo is massive and you
can spend 10 years here and still not
cover everything so my next six stories
will only take place in this small
portion of the country which don't get
me wrong is very important both
economically and historically so with
that all being said I'm really excited
to share with you guys the amazing

place doesn't get any more beautiful
than this see ya
